prompt: Explore the psychological and physiological effects of chronic stress. Discuss the role of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, the impact on immune functioning, and how prolonged stress contributes to mental and physical health conditions. Provide examples and cite supporting research.

criteria.name: Understanding of Stress Mechanisms
criteria.description: Explains biological and psychological mechanisms involved in the stress response.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains the HPA axis, cortisol release, and links to both psychological and physiological outcomes.
performance_descriptors.good: Good understanding with minor gaps in detail or terminology.
performance_descriptors.average: Covers key concepts but lacks specificity or precision.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Partial or unclear understanding of stress mechanisms.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to describe how stress works biologically or psychologically.

criteria.name: Application to Health Outcomes
criteria.description: Describes effects of chronic stress on mental and physical health.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Connects stress to disorders (e.g., depression, cardiovascular disease) using relevant examples and mechanisms.
performance_descriptors.good: Makes appropriate health links with some detail.
performance_descriptors.average: Basic connections between stress and health; may be general.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Vague or unsupported claims about stress effects.
performance_descriptors.poor: No meaningful connection to health outcomes.

criteria.name: Use of Psychological and Biological Evidence
criteria.description: Refers to studies and theories supporting claims.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Supports points with well-integrated studies (e.g., Selye, Sapolsky, Cohen) and theory (e.g., General Adaptation Syndrome).
performance_descriptors.good: Refers to relevant evidence but may not fully explain significance.
performance_descriptors.average: Evidence present but underdeveloped or disconnected.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or unclear reference to research.

criteria.name: Academic Style and Clarity
criteria.description: Presents content in a formal academic style with clear structure and referencing.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Fluent, formal tone with logical flow and accurate APA citations.
performance_descriptors.good: Mostly clear and formal, with minor writing issues.
performance_descriptors.average: Some inconsistencies in tone or structure.
performance_descriptors.poor: Poor organization or lack of academic tone.

key_points: Define chronic stress and distinguish it from acute stress.
Explain the function of the HPA axis and how it regulates the stress response.
Describe how prolonged cortisol exposure weakens immune system functioning.
Link chronic stress to conditions like depression, cardiovascular disease, and gastrointestinal problems.
Reference theories and studies like General Adaptation Syndrome (Selye), Sapolsky work on stress, and Cohen cold virus experiment.
Maintain formal academic tone and cite sources using APA style.
llm_questions: What is the difference between acute and chronic stress?
How does the HPA axis function in response to chronic stress?
What are the long-term effects of cortisol on the immune system?
Can you explain how stress contributes to diseases like depression or heart disease?
What psychological theories explain the body stress response?
Which studies have shown links between stress and physical illness?
Can you help me structure an essay on the physiological effects of stress?
How do I reference Sapolsky or Selye work in APA format?
